item.title: Adjusting hypotheses
item.description: I recently experienced a pattern-recognition failure, which inspired some thoughts about machine intelligence. Arriving at a T hallway intersection at a hotel, I glanced at the following sign: [ â†’ Elevators ] My automatic response was to veer towards the left side. As I was turning, something “felt” wrong, similar to the discomfort experienced when reading a misspelled word. This prompted me to pause and this time read the sign more carefully, thus revealing that the elevators where in fact located to my right.
